newsitem.title: USA: Mississippi jobless rate drops to 5.3 pct in Sept.
newsitem.headline: Mississippi jobless rate drops to 5.3 pct in Sept.

text.p: Mississippi's unemployment rate dropped to 5.3 percent in September from 6.5 percent in August and 6.6 percent a year ago, the Mississippi Employment Security Commission said Friday.
The rate was the lowest so far this eyar, and the lowest for September since 1979.
The number of unemployed Mississippi residents dropped by 15,700 over the month, while 6,100 people gained jobs in August, said Raiford Crews, chief of labor market iformation.
The state lost 14,400 manufacturing jobs over the year, but other market sectors, especially services, have taken up the slack, Crews said.
Jobs in amusements grew by 3,400 over the year while health services grew by 2,700 jobs.

"Growth is expected over the next several months, even though at a slightly slower pace," Crews said. "The trade industry should show its usual seasonal growth as we enter the holiday season. This year should end up as one of the better years in recent times, economically speaking."
Lafayette County had Mississippi's lowest unemployment rate, 1.8 percent, while Panola County had the highest, 16.9 percent.
